docs.snippet: BAIRD--Annette Feder, age 89 passed away on April 5, 2013 in Summit, NJ - a week before her 90th birthday. Annette was a vivacious, vibrant lover of life and humankind. She graduated from Queens College and worked as a chemist for Columbia Univers...
docs.lead_paragraph: BAIRD--Annette Feder, age 89 passed away on April 5, 2013 in Summit, NJ - a week before her 90th birthday. Annette was a vivacious, vibrant lover of life and humankind. She graduated from Queens College and worked as a chemist for Columbia University and General Foods before raising two children and later becoming a devoted volunteer guide at The Boston Museum of Science. There, for over 25 years, she gave tours and specialized in electron microscope demonstrations. Visiting school groups were a special treat for her. Annette enjoyed baseball, jazz, and theater - and had a lifelong love of the arts, science, literature, and learning - which she shared with her beloved husband Donald (her partner for 59-years), her children Allison Fox and Douglas Baird, and her grandchildren - Katie and Julian Fox and Gregory Baird. Annette will be dearly missed and remembered always with great love.

docs.snippet: 9 P.M. (MTV, Logo, VH1) 2013 MTV MOVIE AWARDS Rebel Wilson (above right, with Channing Tatum) hosts this ceremony, broadcast live from the Sony Pictures Studio in Culver City, Calif. The awards bestow Golden Popcorn statuettes on winners in &#x201...
docs.lead_paragraph:
9 P.M. (MTV, Logo, VH1) 2013 MTV MOVIE AWARDS Rebel Wilson (above right, with Channing Tatum) hosts this ceremony, broadcast live from the Sony Pictures Studio in Culver City, Calif. The awards bestow Golden Popcorn statuettes on winners in “best” categories like kiss, villain, fight and shirtless performance. Jamie Foxx will be presented with the annual MTV Generation Award; Will Ferrell will be honored with the first Comedic Genius Award; and Emma Watson is the Trailblazer Award recipient. Presenters include Brad Pitt, Peter Dinklage, Steve Carell, Zac Efron, Kerry Washington, Seth Rogen, Chris Rock, Adam Sandler and Kim Kardashian. Macklemore and Ryan Lewis, Selena Gomez and the cast of “Pitch Perfect” are scheduled to perform. 
 
10 A.M. (Fox) FOX NEWS SUNDAY Senator Marco Rubio, Republican of Florida and a member of the bipartisan Senate group known as the Gang of Eight, discusses the group’s plan for comprehensive immigration reform. He also appears on “This Week,” at 10 on ABC; “Face the Nation,” at 10:30 on CBS; and “Meet the Press,” at 10:30 on NBC.

docs.lead_paragraph: About the Best Sellers: These lists are an expanded version of those appearing in the April 14, 2013 print edition of the Book Review, reflecting sales for the week ending March 30, 2013. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above it. A dagger (†) indicates that some retailers report receiving bulk orders. For an explanation of our methodology, visit http://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers.

docs.snippet: An illegal ball drop by Tiger Woods was first brought to the attention of Masters officials in a text message, highlighting the unusual relationship between those who enforce the rules and television viewers....
docs.lead_paragraph: An illegal ball drop by Tiger Woods was first brought to the attention of Masters officials in a text message, highlighting the unusual relationship between those who enforce the rules and television viewers.
docs.abstract: Illegal ball drop by Tiger Woods during Masters was first brought to attention of officials via text message, highlighting unusual relationship between golf officials and spectators; television viewers have multiple ways of contacting tournament officials, making golf a rare sport in which real-time communication between armchair viewership and referees supervising competition routinely changes rulings and alters outcomes of tournaments.

headline.seo: By Phone or by Text, Golf Entertains Second-Guessers
headline.main: Attention, Second-Guessers: Golf Takes Calls (and Texts)
headline.print_headline: Attention, Second-Guessers: Golf Takes Calls (and Texts)

byline.original: By BILL PENNINGTON and KAREN CROUSE

docs.snippet: Lifestyles for the Disabled, a daytime occupational program for developmentally delayed adults, runs several radio talk shows that help its members increase self-esteem....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lifestyles for the Disabled, a daytime occupational program for developmentally delayed adults, runs several radio talk shows that help its members increase self-esteem.
docs.abstract: Lifestyles for the Disabled, occupational program for developmentally delayed adults on Staten Island, broadcasts radio talk show segments featuring program participants; organizers credit  shows with building confidence and self-esteem, and say they are an entertaining, bold forum for integrating developmentally delayed adults into the public.

headline.seo: Radio Personalities at Lifestyles for the Disabled Make Their Voices Heard

docs.snippet: It takes a reputation to make a reputation. International rankings have become so influential that some countries use them to set policy....
docs.lead_paragraph: It takes a reputation to make a reputation. International rankings have become so influential that some countries use them to set policy.
docs.abstract: London magazine Times Higher Education releases its list of World Reputation Rankings for universities; like influential US News and World Report lists, international academic rankings are increasingly impossible to ignore, as good reputation means more applications, more tuition dollars and greater levels of alumni giving.

headline.main: Vying for a Spot on the World’s A List
headline.print_headline: Vying for a Spot On the World’s A List
